Exaggerate: The claim that "weed kills corona virus" is an exaggeration because there is no proof that marijuana can treat the novel coronavirus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or scientific research provided to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that marijuana has the ability to kill the novel coronavirus without any factual basis or scientific evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides alternative explanations by stating that the CDC and World Health Organization do not recommend smoking or self-medication as remedies for the coronavirus, and that marijuana can have negative effects on attention, memory, and learning.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is currently no vaccine or specific antiviral treatment recommended for the novel coronavirus.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by making an unsupported and unsubstantiated statement about the ability of weed to kill the coronavirus.
